subject: Re: [junit] failSame,. etc. will be public?
msgSnippet: ... OK. I can see that, but I think that s a very bad idea. A JUnit assertion test failure is not at all the same thing as a Java language assert failure. They
messageBody:
Alexandru Popescu wrote:

> As far as I can tell I think that the new Assert class was created to remove the custom
> AssertionException and use the AssertionException provided since JDK1.4. From my point of view this
> is definitely a very good reason to have it.

OK. I can see that, but I think that's a very bad idea. A JUnit
assertion test failure is not at all the same thing as a Java language
assert failure. They are two different things and they should be
distinguishable. Failure to do that might cause unexpected problems with
various tools that interpret an AssertionError as meaning one thing when
JUnit makes it mean something different.

--
